Metadata: Functional characterizatio​n of the cyclomarin/cycl​omarazine prenyltransfera​se cymd directs the biosynthesis of unnatural cyclic peptides

In vitro and in vivo characterizatio​n of the cyclomarin/cycl​omarazine prenyltransfera​se CymD revealed its ability to prenylate tryptophan prior to incorporation into both cyclic peptides by the nonribosomal peptide synthetase CymA. This knowledge was utilized to bioengineer novel derivatives of these marine bacterial natural products by providing synthetic N-alkyl tryptophans to a prenyltransfera​se-​deficient mutant of Salinispora arenicola CNS-205.
